subject: Programming
title: Small Functions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Small Functions usable.

hook.text: A 500-line function is not a function. It's a novel nobody wants to read.

buildup.text: Clean Code recommends functions be short ‚Äî ideally under 20 lines, doing exactly one thing.

discovery.text: Small functions are easy to name, easy to test, and easy to reuse across the codebase.

twist.text: Critics say too-small functions create indirection hell. Readers jump between dozens of files.

climax.text: The balance: small enough to understand at a glance, large enough to tell a complete story.

punchline.text: If a function needs a scroll bar, it's too long.

quiz.question: What does Clean Code recommend for function length?
